That is to say, he is not greatly renowned and virtuous, and is unable to inspire others to provide medicine and supplies. This is called a good man who is endowed with swiftness and color, but not with form.

That is to say, a good man who truly understands this noble truth of suffering, and so on, up to not experiencing rebirth, is called endowed with swiftness.

That is to say, if a good man is asked about Abhidharma and Vinaya, he is able to explain and resolve them. This is called being endowed with color.

That is to say, a good man who is greatly renowned and virtuous, and is able to inspire others to provide medicine and supplies, is called endowed with form. This is called a good man who is endowed with swiftness, color, and form.
